clusters.name: Asynchronous JavaScript Fundamentals
clusters.description: This cluster covers the core concepts and mechanisms for handling asynchronous operations in JavaScript, essential for understanding modern web development patterns and interview questions related to concurrency and non-blocking I/O.

items.reason: This item (assumed to be 'Callbacks and Promises') introduces the fundamental patterns for managing asynchronous code execution, serving as a prerequisite for understanding more complex asynchronous mechanisms. It is foundational to mastering asynchronous JavaScript.

Building directly on the understanding of asynchronous patterns like callbacks and promises, this item (assumed to be 'JavaScript Event Loop') provides a deeper insight into how JavaScript handles non-blocking operations internally. Understanding the Event Loop is crucial for debugging and optimizing asynchronous code.
